lines.text: That woman is unbelievable. She's awesome. She knows exactly what I want her to do, and she does it before I even ask her to do it.
I had a woman like that once. Once was all I could afford.
I can't call him because he's in a coma!
A coma? Come on, Barbara. Come up with something a little more original. How about - oh, I know. How about a hole opened up, and James fell into the center of the earth?
Talking to Alison is like trying to nail Jello to a tree.

[Looking through the Hughes' refrigerator]
Give it a few weeks. I've got to tell you something, I've got some irons in the fire. My ship is coming in. I can see a silver lining in that cloud that's been hanging over me for so long. I'm all out of clichés, baby. But I think you get my drift, don't you?
Yes I do. But I don't think you understand the urgency of my plight.
A-ha!
[pulls out a bottle and looks at the lable]
Creme de menthe? Oh Lord, who are these people, mad?

Please, please, please. I can not bear it any longer, okay. Okay, all right, I will let you - I give you permission to use a little of that money from B.J. Henry, we can share a place. You can use it and we can share a place.
That money - that money's off limits for now, okay?
You're right. I shouldn't even mentioned - what was I thinking?
I don't know. Shame on you, shame on you.
[takes a drink and spits it out]
Oh God! What am I supposed to drink this or gargle with it?
What am I supposed to do?
Why don't you try making up with Casey? What the hell?
[takes another sip]
I would rather stick my head in a lion's mouth. Are you still gonna drink that?
Yes! It's that bad, huh? Listen, for every problem there is a solution.
You sound like my calculus teacher.
Judge Steve?
Dude, just tell us.
You may well hate my guts in ten years.
Why?
Because you'll be having your 10th wedding anniversary before you're 30.
Yes!
Or you'll be bitter and divorced a half-decade ahead of schedule. And don't send me a card if that's the last one.
Will you keep your pants on when you're alone with Maddie?
I can't believe you said that!
All right, come on, it freaks me out, too.
You're my mom! I'm your impressionable teenage son! Geez!
Well, look, I finally got more than one word out of you.
A shame to waste good vodka, Barbara.
Somehow I think it won't go to waste.
My entire life, honestly - men. My father, Tom, Paul - none of them ever wanted me.
There's still good ol' Hal...
Yeah, Hal - I came in second to a warm doughnut, Henry.
Face it, Emily. Shooting your fiance is a definite turnoff.
Yeah, you know what? One would think, but obviously not.
I'm surprised, I'm surprised after having one your Mom didn't stop right there. What was she thinking?
She wasn't thinking, she was weighing the odds. You know, this horse, that horse. Mater had a bit of a gambling problem.
She hung out at the track?
All day, every day. If you're a thoroughbred you get her attention, but if you're just some mutt on two legs... you know.
Well, she seems like a great kid.

She's a smart kid, Emily, and she sees right through you like cheap cellophane. Now, I do not have a dark side, and I don't want to be any part of yours. If you want to put out a hit out on Meg, you call the mob. And if you ever reveal any of your twisted schemes in front of my little sister again, I will call the mob myself.
She's gone? Henry, are you having an affair?
With Emily Stewart?
You know, you can tell me if you two are.
Not.
Good. I don't really like her.
She has that effect on people.
But I do think she has the hots for you.
She does not have the hots for me. She has her talons dug into some other poor slob.
Really?
Yeah. She's crazy about him. Literally. It couldn't happen to a nicer guy.
Now, aren't you supposed to be at home carving up some helpless squash, anyway?
That's Thanksgiving, genius.
And while you're at it, you'll get yourself out of jail?
I have to. I know that orange is the new black, but those jumpsuits make my butt look enormous.
I don't know, your butt looks pretty good to me.
Hello, Gwen.
Oh, great. Great. Just what I need first thing in the morning.
Oh, sorry, sorry. I was out yesterday because of the stupid wedding and I had to stop by the hospital.
What wedding?
Oh, that's right, you weren't invited. Your son married my daughter.
What? That's impossible. Paul's still in jail.
They got married in the cell. It was everything a mother could hope for, cement floors, iron bars, armed guards, and a son-in-law who's a murderer.
Well, honey, I must say you were almost civil where Gwen was concerned.
lines.character: Lisa Miller Hughes Eldridge Shea Colman McColl Mitchell Grimaldi Chedwyn #1

lines.text: Oh, I'm trying.
I know. I think that's wonderful. If I had known that a run-in with a bear would change your attitude, I would have taken you to the zoo a long time ago.
lines.character: Lisa Miller Hughes Eldridge Shea Colman McColl Mitchell Grimaldi Chedwyn #1

lines.text: I know this is hard for you to deal with. It's hard for me, too. I spent so many years of my life trying to push these feelings down, deny them, change them. And so have you. So I don't think you should pretend to be so surprised.
Well, I sure as hell was surprised to see what I saw today! You led me to believe that you and Maddie were a couple! When did you turn into such a... good liar?
I've been lying to myself forever. Trying to convince myself- trying to convince you! It took over my life.
So what else in our life was a lie?
The idea that there was something wrong with me. That's why you wanted me to join the army, that's why you were so happy that me and Maddie were moving in together.
That was not my idea, Noah! And how could you do this to her?
That was a mistake. Haven't you ever made a mistake? Dad?
Obviously I made a hell of a lot of them with you.
It's not your fault I'm gay! It's nobody's fault. And guess what? I'm happy with who I am. Finally! For the first time in my life.
Noah, he has you under some kind of spell but it's not too late! You don't have to end up like this! I won't let him destroy you-!

[Getting up from his wheelchair]
That is the opposite of what I'm doing! I love your son! And we're together! And we are not afraid to let the world see that! You talk about what's right? This is right! Me and Noah, together, and you locked up in a prison where you belong!

When I first came out, it was fine, but I was lonely. I looked at Will and Gwen, and Casey and Maddie, and I thought, "That is something that I'm never gonna have." And not just the attraction, but... I don't know, just... just the feeling of... of walking into a room, and having someone there who's happy to see you. You know? Not having to say everything, spell everything out. But still having someone who knows what you mean. And I think... I think these feelings have a word. And you don't have to say this back, you-you don't have to say this back... but... I love you, Noah. I'm so... in love with you.

[Sitting after walking in on an awkward moment between Zack and Noah]
... Okay. What was that about?
Zac kissed me.
...What?
Zac kissed me, don't worry, it was harmless.

[Exasperated]
Are you serious?
It came out of the blue. It's not going to happen again, he got no encouragement. None!

[sighing]
Oh, man, I knew he had a thing for you.
It was no big deal!
No big deal? The last time you saw someone kiss me you punched him in the face!

[after meeting Noah for the first time and noticing Luke's behavior around him]
... Everything alright at work?
Yeah!
Something just seemed a little off. He didn't want any help with that edit.
Ah, Noah knows what he's doing. He doesn't need me looking over his shoulder.
Hm. Seems like a good kid. Don't you like him?
What? Oh! Yeah, yeah! Yeah.
What's going on?
...Dad. I really, *really* don't wanna talk about this with you.
I just don't wanna see you unhappy, especially after everything that... happened with Kevin.
Okay. Kevin, that was completely different. You know. Kevin wasn't g-
[pauses]
It was just different.

[Eager]
Yes, this is different. You work with this guy. He's dating Maddie. She's your friend.
Dad, I know. I get it. And I have it under control, so don't worry, okay?
You're my son. One day you'll be 52, and you know who I'm gonna be worried about? You.
[Luke is wheelchair bound]
Let's just... let's do something physical.

[Playfully]
Like what?
Like your physical therapy.
[Luke looks defeated]
I didn't do that for you, I just couldn't stand to see that psycho slut with her hands all over my boyfriend.
I love you.
[Dusty is sitting on a bench. Lucinda approaches him eating ice cream]
Hey. Hey, buddy! That's my bench.
Hey, I pay my taxes, and I was here first.
Now wait a minute! I had it first, I just got up for a seventh inning stretch. Okay?
Well you didn't leave a sign so you're outta luck!
[Short pause]
Okay, I'll share. C'mere.

[Reluctant]
Okay. I'll share.
[Sits down]
What have you got there?

[Holds cone away from Dusty]
Yeah, but you can't have a lick of my cone. I need this.
It's dripping.
I need it, you know? I need... the icy perfection!
...That's weird. I could have sworn I left this closed. You didn't go into it for anything, did you?
Uh, I was the guy mucking out the stall next to you? When would I have done that?

[Sits across from Noah]
Hey!
[Notices his large sandwich]
Well, I guess your film editing class gives you a pretty big appetite, huh? What, the banana split I made for you wasn't big enough?
No, it was great, I just had to miss lunch because I was studying. And that sugar fix was good but no substitute for four different kinds of meat.
Well, if I didn't know better I'd say you were sublimating something.
Oh, get out, that psych class is going to your head.
My professor, Dr. Freudenheim, would say that your increased appetite was due to an acute oral fixation.
So, what, are you saying this is... all about sex?

[laughs]
Oh, no, I didn't say that. *You* said that. Must be on your mind.
It is... all the time, actually. How about you?

[Later]
Okay, well then, what's your fantasy first time? You know, would it be, lit by candlelight with rose petals strewn about the duvet?
I don't even know how to *spell* duvet. And as far as rose petals go, you can cut that out of my movie.
Okay, okay, so I guess the bearskin rug B&B is out of the picture. Well, what about, um... oh! What about, like, all sweaty and hot in the locker room after like a really rough game of handball?
...Have you been watching porn?
At my grandma's house? No!
Well, you certainly have an active imagination!
That's because I'm a writer! I have to, it's my job!
[Luke is attempting to keep an injured Noah conscious]

Noah. Noah, y-you have to wake up, I have a question for you. Do you remember that film we watched a couple nights ago, you know, the one from your-from your film class? The uh, the four hours of Light on the Seer's Tower. You told me that it was a masterpiece, but I didn't get it so, so you have to explain to me what-what I missed.

[Slurring]
Uh... the film is light, it's uh... it's the emotional palette of the artist and it's used to, um...
[coughs]
To what? To what? It's the emotional palette of the artist, it's used to what?
Uh... to express... his vision. And the broader the spectrum, the broader...
[Begins to lose consciousness]

[Tittering]
Come on! Hey, hey! Hey, I'm about to fall asleep, too! Come on! I just insulted existential film making! You gonna let me get away with it? Noah? Noah, come on!

You may not know who you are, but he doesn't know one thing about you. And what he thinks about you, that doesn't matter. So, you wanna know what you can do for me? You can prove to me that the man who put me in this chair didn't win. That you, and me, are stronger than he ever was. That's what you can do for me.
Do you wanna dance?
Uh, I'm gay.
I'm Stacy, and you didn't really answer my question.

[Damian and Lily have run downstairs half dressed]
I really don't know what to say right now.
Luke, I f-... I found your mother outside, and I brought her home. She was so upset, I couldn't leave her on her own.
So you decided to take her clothes off? Mom?
Go easy on your mother, Luciano.
Faith walked in on the two of you in bed, didn't she? That's why she ran out of here! UGH! What is *wrong* with you? With both of you?
I should have locked the door...
You should have locked the door? Is that what you have to say for yourself?
I need to find Faith before something happens.
It's too late.
No, I can explain! I-I need to make her understand...
No, mom, you need to make *me* understand, because right now I don't, and I don't think I ever will!
[Lily tries to go past him]
Mom! Are you crazy? Faith doesn't want to talk to you right now!
No, Luke! I need to make her understand-!
No, you need to go and get some clothes on! *I* will handle Faith.
Luke, I'll go with you.
No, Damian, you've done enough.
Luciano...
Damian, get away from me. I need to find my little sister.
[Bickering at the food table at Kim and Bob's anniversary party]
Katie said you were going to order some food from Al's. When do we eat that?
You don't.
Doogie Hughes, how do you stop this whole Holden family sermon?
You don't.
[Reid is having a panic attack]
Alright, um, Dr. Oliver, you-you need to focus. Um... think about some place that you like, some place that makes you feel safe.
Where'd you pick up this load of crap, magazines at your dentist's office?
Well, does it matter if it works?
Yeah, it's just a bogus pop psychology.
Well, do you have anything better to do, like put your fist through the wall and ruin your career forever?
Yeah, not to mention ruin your mom's elevator.
Oh, don't worry. You'd get the bill. You know how stingy rich people are.
Okay. Okay, I-I-I have a place.
Okay, well, what is it?
[Silence from Reid]
Doctor. What is the place you're thinking of?
It's the brain.

[chuckles]
Figures.
Well, i-if I'd told you it was this... green meadow with tadpoles and dancing cows you'd know I was lying, so...
Well, is it any brain in particular?
I-I don't... each one's different.
[sighs]

They're all amazing, though. It has this tangled... mass of... grey spaghetti, it's totally alien. But... it's not much to look at to the naked eye, but... yet it makes us... walk and talk, think... remember, smell... love. It produced the Sistine Chapel. Chocolate. Theory of relativity. Godfather, parts one and two. Not so sure about three, but...
You said that Noah's surgery and his recovery would be very time consuming.
You think you're gonna win points by repeating my words back to me?
Wait. Hey. You can't just... leave him here, what-what if he trips over a nurse?
Hey, listen, I... look, I know the guy did a lot of bad things and probably hurt a lot of people, but Damien... he's still your father.
That's nice of you to say.
Yeah. It happens sometimes, as much as I try to prevent it.
Well... the truth is I gave him so many chances. When he first found out I was gay he tried to fix me. I forgave him for that!
It must have been tough having your father wanna change you.
Well, he finally accepted me, so... I gave him another chance.
Makes you wonder if the first change was real.
Yeah... it does. I don't know why I'm talking to you about this.
Well, like I said. Sometimes I'm a good guy in spite of myself.
And of course, it's so like you to go about this without even acknowledging what happened the other day.
...Nothing happened between us the other day.
No, I know, I know, I know... I was talking about the guy at the Lakeview who said you murdered his daughter.
...Oh. That.
Chronic fatigue.
[pause]
I wanna ship him COD to a leper colony. See how tired he is then.
I am not going to interfere in your life any more. If you want to make Dr. Nightmare over there your next big mistake, that is your business, not mine.
Henry. He is my room mate, that's all!
Bubbles, I know you better than you know your own self. You are lonely, you're vulnerable, you're sad right now, it's only a matter of time before you fall for him.
Um, nope. You're wrong.
No, you love being in love, usually with the wrong guy!

[Coming up behind them, laughing]
Sorry. He does have a point, though.
Chris, not helping.
I didn't know you were back, it's good to see you.
[Shakes Chris' hand]
Yeah, you too, you too. So, um, who is this wrong guy that Katie is... madly in love with?
He thinks it's Reid.
[Chris laughs incredulously]
No, no, no, no! No, Chris, don't laugh, it's not funny! You have not been here to see what's gone on!
he is the wrong guy for Katie.
See?
Chris doesn't like him, either.
No one likes him! You're the only one that likes him!
Yeah, but it has nothing to do with that.
[Turns to Reid]
Um... do you wanna tell him?
I'm the wrong guy for Katie.

[Sarcastically]
Really? Now, how could that be? I thought you were perfect!
I am. I also happen to be gay.
Do you have any idea how childish that sounds?
Yep. But it's not as ridiculous as you chasing me all over town whining that I'm not gonna play with your toy.
You're messing with me, you're not gay!
You're requiring proof? How would that work exactly?
Well, you never mentioned anything. Are you really that deep in the closet?
Mr. Snyder, I've known that I was gay since I was nine years old. I can assure you that in all that time I've never once hidden, apologized for, or been ashamed of who I am.
Well that I can believe, but... you never said anything to Noah or me.
Why would I?
Because it could have helped!
What, so we could share the secret handshake?
It's called relating, Dr. Oliver. You meet someone, you learn things about them. You find what you have in common, and then you get along better.
So you're telling me that if I had told you that I'm a Pisces, yet, ironically, allergic to fish, you and I would have bonded?
Maybe.
You forgot, didn't you? We have a meeting with the architect of the new wing today. We have to sign off on the preliminary plans?
Yeah, well, let the architect wear the tie. He's the one who has to impress me.
You can't go to a meeting in scrubs.
Okay, fine! I'll change my clothes, I'll head over to the Lakeview and I'll meet the guy.
I'm going with you.

[Sarcastic]
Oh, of course. I know how concerned you are about the placement of the stereotaxis system. Tell me, do you prefer the gamma knife or the cyber knife?
Mmm... I'll let you know?
I can't wait.
Dr. Oliver, this is Dusty's fiancée, Janet Snyder.
Who?
The shooting victim.
Oh, hello.
Please, Dr. Oliver, you have to save Dusty! He's a great man, and he has a lot to live for.
Yeah, okay. I don't care who he is. He could be a concert pianist or a serial killer, I'd still do my job. Excuse me.
[Rushes off]
[Janet and Carly are in shock]
Uh, some bedside manner!
He's like that with everyone. But Dusty is in good hands, I promise. If anyone can save Dusty, it's Dr. Oliver.

[approaching Luke at Java]
Glad I found you.
Why?
No reason.
[pauses, then sits down at Luke's table]
So, how's it going?

[Taken aback]
How's... what going?
You know, life?
...Seriously?
Yeah, how's the boyfriend?
Well, he's an ex-boyfriend, and I think you'd know better than I would, you see him every day.
Oh. Yeah, right. Um, he's good, in case you were wondering.
What is wrong with you?
Nothing, I'm just being friendly.
Why? You don't do friendly.
There's no reason why we can't get along.
Seriously? The world's greatest doctor and "Richie-Rich"?
Yeah. Sorry about that, don't lis-I was just being...
What, friendly?
Yeah, right.
Well, you can stop, because it really doesn't suit you. You obviously want something, so why don't you just ask me, I'll say no, and then you can go back to being yourself.

[the elevator is stuck]
God, I can't believe this is happening to me...
[bangs on the door]
Hey! Hey, can anybody hear us? There are two people stuck in this elevator! Is anybody out there? I knew this town was cursed. Hey, security!
You're really freaking out.
Leave me alone! A little help would be nice, you know?

[Amused]
Do you have a phobia of elevators?
Oh, don't be ridiculous. I-I just don't want us to be late for that appointment.
Well, like you said. The architect works for us, he'll wait.

[Loosening his tie and dabbing at his face]
We'd be there by now if you hadn't been going into all your Kumbaya suggestions.
Dr. Oliver...?
Just leave me alone.
Wow... you are seriously claustrophobic!
No, I-I-I don't, uh, like tight spaces...
And here I thought you were invincible! Are you scared of spiders, too?
[laughs]
Okay, wow, wow. Don't worry. I wouldn't dare bug you out I mean... imagine if this entire elevator started shaking... and then, we crashed to the bottom...
Okay, don't. Don't. Don't-!

[Talking over Reid]
And then, we were crushed by these four walls closing in on us!
Stop! It's not funny!
Oh, I think it's hilarious!
[Jumps up and down]
Boom, ba-da boom, ba-da boom!

[Shoves Luke up against the wall]
Do you want us to be smashed to pieces! Stop it!
...Wow. For someone with nerves of steel... that was pretty extreme.
[Looks at Reid's lips]
You want me to admit that I'm human? Would that make your day, Mr. Snyder?
Be a start.
Well, how would you feel if the man you loved was shot and killed before he had a chance to see his kid?
I'm not quite sure how to answer that.

Well, you'd be a mess. And if you were Katie, that would mean long crying, hysterical jags till like three A.M., inappropriate laughter and sudden mood swings and rage and then smashing the dishes which scares the bejeezus out of the baby, but you being a world famous brain surgeon I'm sure you could handle all of that, cutting into noggins all day, so you must have nerves of steel, which you are going to need.
I sleep with ear plugs.
[Awkward silence]
Finally! I'm sorry, I didn't mean for it to come out that way, it's just that, we didn't know where you were, and...
Even hostages have to eat, Mr. Snyder. I was down in the cafeteria consuming something that called itself 'lunch', but there's nothing like those orange plastic trays to remind you of botulism.
[Short, awkward pause. Noah clears his throat]
...Have you gotten a chance to look over Noah's file?
That ought to make the bank pretty happy.
Yeah, but just don't expect a free toaster with your new account.

[walking out of the bathroom]
Oi, Goldilocks. Did you use my toothbrush?
No.
Somebody used it, I don't think it was Jacob.
What makes you think someone used it?
Because it was in the right slot facing to the right. I always keep it in the left slot facing to the left.
...Why would you do that?
Because I'm a rigid, methodical person and it comforts me?
[Aaron and Alison discuss their marriage]
Alison, we've been through a fire in a barn. We've run from the cops. We've been in jail. Come on, compared to that, what's marriage? Gotta be a piece of cake.
Ali, listen, listen. Before we do anything crazy, just explain to me what this part means, okay? "Where fowl reigns supreme and lambs dare not roam and pigs in a blanket say take me home."
Okay, fowl - that's like chickens and roosters and stuff, right? Okay, and "tuck in but don't let sleeping dogs lie".
Ali?
Shh, I'm about to be brilliant. I got it. The key. The key's is in the buns.
Excuse me?
"Tucked in", get it? The way that you tuck a hotdog inside the bread? I need to buy your buns.
